w19qc5wuraHdhuGyOipWkw.text: Afternoon staff are good. But this evening I went for a burrito bowl and the food handler put a Tablespoon worth of rice, and just enough beans to cover it. My kid has had more filling in a kids meal at other Chipotle locations. Anyway, after requesting more rice and beans, they charged me extra. Really low. Probably won't go back in the evening.

0kGIRxuPf70PKJ_DMwuaYg.text: This Chipotle really is the worst I've ever been to in terms of sanitary hygiene. I came here about a month and a half ago and the woman serving was wiping her nose with her wrist (gloved hand, but at that point what difference does it make?) I stopped going to this one for a while because that seriously turned me off. I came back 2 days ago, seriously craving a "Chipotle burrito." My boyfriend found a hair in his food! NASTY!! That should have been the final warning for me. They handled it like any restaurant with poor customer service would, got him a new one. No refund, no free chips and guac, nothing to accommodate for that at all. Ok, so of course I'm craving Chipotle again today and as my bowl is being assembled the server decided to turn around and tap her buddy on the back with her, AGAIN, gloved hand and then once she got his attention, grabbed at the cheese and lettuce with the same hand!!!! I've had it with this place! I got home and threw the bowl out (I know silly of me to pay for it.) But I planned to call their corporate and let them know how unhygienic this place. To bad this is a franchise so I'm out of my $8. Seriously train and manage these people on how to better handle people's food because this place is gross!!!

VcniibDhMJrZZc5TMLyX4w.text: You really can't go wrong at Chipotle.  I value their commitment to fresh ingredients, and it is a great alternative to fast-food.  I always opt for the vegetarian bowl with brown rice, black beans, grilled peppers, salsa, corn, lettuce, and guacamole.  They are a little on the pricey side given that the meal does not include any chips and salsa.  When we arrived (peak lunch hour) they had run out of brown rice and the people behind me had to settle for white.

Kg-05SvRtKt9GXLerzCAzg.text: The food was good, albeit a bit spicy.  My wife is very sensitive to spicy foods, and can't eat any at all. We asked the server if the food was cooked spicy, she assured us it wasn't - that the only spicy item would be the salsas or the barbacoa, but the chicken was not spicy. However, my wife couldn't eat her burrito, as it was far too spicy. I tasted it, and there was a decent zing to it.  Other than that, the food was fresh and well-cooked. They had just swapped out the black beans and white rice when we walked in with a fresh batch, so those items were very good. The barbacoa had good flavor, although the cook was a bit heavy-handed with the spicy seasonings. That seems to be a trend here.  The guacamole was decent. For almost $2 extra to put a dollop of guacamole, it needs to be much better than it was for me to buy it again.  All in all, Chipotle doesn't stand out for me among Moe's, Qdoba, or Salsarita's. It's nice that the food is all organic, but it doesn't matter when it's killed with spice.

N3yDzXYXwq1QNwscDQDelw.text: Wasn't much better this time. No one was working the cash register and the girl serving was flirting with the cook the whole time and made it Obvious they were sleeping together while ignoring me and other customers. Very rude to lady behind me and barely gave her any meat. Wish they was another location close by!

F-rZohjUmGuGez7GFF-luw.text: The one guy didn't know how to roll a burrito. That would be like a nascar driver who can't drive. Because of that, the line was super long. I got a chicken bowl after seeing the guy roll the burrito in front of me. Chicken was good. My wife's steak bowl was bad. Beet had a ton of fat and was chewy.

uHvqovLDjtdrLHe96x1U9g.text: I eat at Chipotle very regularly and have to say that this one in particular is the worst I have eaten at. The dining area is consistently a mess, and there is typically a line that takes forever to get through. Tonight the line was to the door and there was one person actually sitting to eat. The manager kept looking at the line from the back but didn't offer up any assistance to the crew, instead she walked around with a clipboard distracting the people trying to serve the food. Then when I got the food, the chicken was burnt as were the fajita vegetables, but thankfully I didn't get the pintos that looked like they could be used for wallpaper paste. Also, there was food all over the place on the serving line and behind the counter. Not sure how they got that 99 rating from the health department. Guess I will go to the one near 51 and Johnston next time.

TYQRMHXrt8gzw0sBs7_4PQ.text: I was so excited when a Chipotle FINALLY opened up in Matthews, NC, because I recently moved here from Maryland. It doesn't compare to the Chipotle up in College Park next to the University of Maryland where they give a bigger portion, but Chipotle food is always great. I always get my favorite: Barbacoa burrito bowl with pretty much everything in it. They also have burritos and fajitas. Sides of chips with salsa too.  This is a MUST TRY restaurant.

LR71Oh8IUdvkyavJelpQqA.text: First of all I love Chipoltle just not this one! On many a Friday night they are usually out of one ore more items at 6:30 which is ridiculous! We ALWAYS have an issue with this location. The food is great but something is not clicking here. Hope someone reads this that can fix the problem in the kitchen. Until then I'm going to Moe's!!!!

VYY9p5t07OtDscPqm-8AYw.text: Chipotle is a your average step-up-above-fast food Mexican-inspired restaurant.  Think of Qdoba, Moe's, or Salsaritas.  I heard the rave reviews from friends about this chain so I discovered it for myself.  The restaurant was clean (it was brand spanking new at the time) when I visited and the ingredients were fresh.  However, I was dismayed by the lack of options.  The streamlined menu (maybe some people like this) was basically tacos, burritos, or a taco salad.  Nothing particularly original and though the food was good, I wouldn't make a special trip to visit this place again.  This is not to say I wouldn't return, but they are no unique dishes/ingredients that distinguishes it from the aforementioned chains.    Important note-Chipotle is Cali-Mex, rather than Tex-Mex like the other chains.  Therefore, they have leaner sides; less cheeses and sauces and more fresh veggies.  So, if you're like me and prefer heartier Tex-Mex taste, then Qdoba's, Moe's, or Salsarita's would be a better bet.  If you want a leaner Mexican-inspired meal (but still substantial), you might like Chipotle.

_yh9_JZrGSVQCIam_5JUdQ.text: Excellent burritos! The guacomole is delicious and they're generous with it, if you want it. I appreciate that many of their ingredients are free-range and organic. They have competitive prices with other restaurants of similar fare even though their ingredients are superior. It's nice to be able to see (and make adjustments) your burrito being created right in front of your eyes (like Qdoba). Friendly staff as well. OH! And the music has been remarkably enjoyable every time we've been in. OH! One more thing- there's a gated outdoor seating area. It makes it much easier if you have kids who don't want to sit still for long!

sFSUTXWLMAMbt3NiOKsp_g.text: Used to love chipotle but seems like standards are dipping. Hygiene is an issue - the guy with pony tail drops all the red baskets into lettuce. The same lettuce was served to the next customer. The sauce was dripping all over the place from the pita but the guy was oblivious. Luckily the person at register noticed the fiasco and asked if they need to get it wrapped in new pita.  The tables are not cleaned and the place definitely needs some inspection. Bad experience. Looking forward to Providence location.

PVGsK_xe3f_4Qm_LvV8fLQ.text: This is the only chipotle I have been to where they may as well weigh what they give you. They will literally knock ingredients off the spoon. No other one I have been to does that. If I am paying $10 for a burrito bowl at least make it worth it. The food is excellent but the stinginess needs to lighten up.

slcFwc6FB9Qqx4mqDEw6ig.text: Never quite understood all the fanfare about Chipotle. Then, tried a barbacoa burrito 6 months ago for the first time......  Now, I get it.   Delicious- Fresh EVERYTHING, clean good quality meat.    Where do I sign? :)

-2iwTNXW7XzeEJCRl20mFw.text: Great food and fast service. I have visited this location pretty frequently over the last 2 months and have never had an issue. I've never waited in line here more than 10 minutes. After my third visit here the staff knew my order by heart. My only issue is the lack of consistency with the portions for the bowls.

S6PDUwVf-TCA0c1VjmZmHA.text: This location is always busy and the food is great. The only reason for not giving 5 stars is because I feel like the staff can be very slow. I have noticed it the last 5 times I have been there. So it wasn't just a one time thing. So if you want good food and don't mind it taken in a few mins Chipotle is your place. There food is amazing and always taste fresh.

XhFnvxDqGWXjjoUuknvu2g.text: Went here for lunch today. It wasn't stellar and it wasn't poor. Just a "meh" kind of experience, so to speak. The lines weren't that long, so I guess I beat the lunch rush. The servers weren't that generous with the food, barely got any steak on my bowl at all. The steak was also over spiced. Lucky for me I like spicy foods, but for someone who is sensitive to spicy food this might not be such a good.  After all of this, the food was barely warm as well, making the already meh food poor.

-G-D9Ans8T9cVqsAptuhJA.text: While there's nothing mind-blowing about Chipotle, there isn't many bad things to say, especially with this location. The chicken is the specialty of Chipotle, everyone knows that. Every once in a while the chicken is just average, but usually it's very good. The employees are friendly for the most part. I recommend this location.

L7bs4vvvyoNFUV-6LZe9wg.text: It's hard for me to differentiate Chipotle from Salsarita's a lot of times. They are tasty, yes. Being all organic, PETA approved, etc etc is not the biggest concern for me, but that's nice, too. I just have a hard time with this Southwestern cuisine - I'd rather have Mexican, and Chipotle doesn't seem to change my mind.  I do like the food, though. And the staff here is super friendly. It can be a little loud for me, especially with the music up. And their corner of the parking lot is not my favorite navigational experience.  I think my review has circled itself without making a real point. But that's my point exactly - I'm not a fan, but I don't dislike them either.

9uQvELVk3ymn2kg7rUCF5Q.text: I'm a sucker for their chips and guacamole....  I do have to agree with Seth A., there's not that many options, but I guess if you find an item on their menu that you do like, it doesn't really matter then.  The place is really clean.  I mean REALLY clean... almost to the point that it reminds me of a laboratory or hospital.  It may be the excessive amount of stainless steel.  Definitely looks modern, but it lacks some warmth and vibrancy which I always associate with Mexican, or Mexican inspired food.

wAEJQOdb1oSBDXVOpEWN0Q.text: It's not the best Authentic Mexican food out there but definitely the best for fast casual food!

9Gt1wlIt7DJ-zROyGUkzYw.text: Food is always good! I'm giving this a two stars because I've never waited in line less than 20 minutes. They should probably consider hiring more people. It's ridiculous

G39tI0U8uzLIu756yFlc2A.text: I love Chipotle but everytime I come here, the service sucks. I was just up there getting lunch and I heard the young woman behind the counter call this lady who was getting her order corrected a b**** after she left! I couldn't believe she would say that in front of customers!

EHg_hnC3nqekqfFdAb0q3Q.text: I love Chipotle, but unfortunately, this location seems to be poorly managed; they always seem to be out of ingredients and the line moves very slow.  Came here for dinner tonight and there was no brown rice.  In addition, I had to wait for steak.  Aside from that, the food tasted good, just poor service.

mkfsHKutkix4M-s0xKGDOQ.text: This is the only Chipotle I've ever had a problem at in 4 states. I'd placed an online order making a special request. I'd spoken to them twice on the phone before getting there only to be told when I arrived that my request wouldn't be fulfilled. To make matters worse, they had a rude girl at the register with a terrible attitude who patronized me and my request. I will definitely not be returning to this location.

njF2_3lNPjUcKhvIQ44Npw.text: Let me say this up front:  I **LOVE** Chipotle.  I eat it at home, I eat it on the road for business.  Sometimes I will eat it twice a day.  I've eaten the "secret menu" items like the fabled quesorito.  I've eaten it all over the country -- after Chick Fil A, it is hands-down my favorite fast food/fast casual concept.  That being said ... this is unquestionably the worst-managed Chipotle I've ever been to (and lucky me, it's my neighborhood store).  How on earth can they be out of ingredients so often??  And I'm not talking like "hey, do you happen to have cilantro for that?"  No, this is like "sorry, we are out of chicken."  WHAT!?!  CHICKEN!?!  And not just once.  This has happened multiple times.  Tonight it was barbacoa and mild salsa.  Seriously ... "we are out of mild salsa."  Said no Mexican restaurant, ever.  Except Chipotle-Matthews.  This place is perpetually understaffed, and it makes me want to not come here because they have done the unthinkable and ruined a near-perfect product that requires all the brain power of pushing a button on a copy machine to get me to a point of perfect customer satisfaction.  Zero stars, @$$ clowns.  ZERO.

HRGeVEEZUUkfgbYRo2B4gw.text: Let first say that I am a HUGE fan of Chipotle! However, this location NEVER has steak ready to go. When I ask them why they either say they hardly ever sell steak. WELL HELLO!!! You can't sell what you don'e stock!!! You ALWAYS have 10 lbs of Chicken and few dried up old morsels of steak. What do you think the customer will choose? You create your own destiny by under-stocking Steak. You force customers to say,"Well, I'd like the steak, but that stuff looks like it's been sitting around for a while. Hmm, the chicken looks fresh! I'll just go with the chicken." Try stocking steak for a while! Call it the "Dave Experiment". See if you don't sell more steak.

B2lVmO30GdgeKp_t7YVD9w.text: One of my absolute favorite places. Ingredients are always fresh, service is always quick and prices are fair. Beats Qdoba and Moes every time.

1D6jqtiIRHc8yeXK8HN6ag.text: I love tacos from here. I used to get the burrito, but it's just too big. Now, I prefer the tacos, and that way I can get one with each flavor: I'll get a white bean, 2 black beans, and I'll get different salsas on each one. Sometimes, the staff can be a little snarky about my mixing and matching...that's my only complaint.   At this location, you can hop on Brueggers' wireless connection, so it's even nicely wired if you're trying to check your email or get some work done while eating your Tex-Mex goodies. The guacamole is superb, and I enjoy all four of the salsa flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Logo from the website.

ljOk5QVGsnx5YR3LAUNAYw.text: Omg!! I got a gift card for Chipotle. Tried and now I never want to go anywhere else. This place is fantastic. I love the pork carnitas. Most of staff is very nice. Depends on what time of day it is.

vXgZKAJ6w404Ug4uIPQHcA.text: YUM. Seriously. YUM!!!! Everything is delicious. The chicken is spicy- - just the way I like it. (A little too much for my kiddos so they stick to other choices.)  Staff is usually wonderful (I have had the occasional experience with a less-than-fabulous staff member - but, I figure, we are all human).  The food is delicious and made right in front of you.  I read previous reviews and in my experience, when any one item is on the verge of running out, the server is quick to request more from the kitchen staff (who have always been busy at their station).  I've never had to wait for more than a few seconds for any item to be replenished.  The addition of a kid's menu to Chipotle is the best idea since sliced bread. My kids, who would never dream of eating beans of any type, readily eat them when ordering the "taco kit" - it's 2 tortillas (soft or crunchy) + ANY 3 items... we usually get pinto beans, cheese and their AWESOME guacamole + drink + tiny bag of chips.  Kids are happy, parents are happy.. WIN WIN!  This location has offered margaritas for awhile now on their menu but in reality is still waiting for liquor license to be processed.  So they are not actually available yet.  The indoor and outdoor dining areas as well as the restrooms have always been clean.  Highest rating for Chipotle on every point!

E2tAikmfILDRzFGCB7i-NQ.text: Anyone who knows me, knows the depth of my affection for Chipotle. So it pains me to say that this Chipotle location would turn any believer away.  I went in for a late lunch on a Saturday at the end of Feb and I immediately noticed that they were severely understaffed. As the line moved up to my position, I began to hear the employee say they were running out of chicken (and some other meat). When it was my turn, I had taken the last portion of chicken and the next person was told that the next batch of chicken WAS STILL COOKING and there would be at least a 10-20 minute wait.  As for the rest of the toppings, they all seemed to be running low and it was all very messy. I could only see two girls in the back and they were in no rush to re-fill anything nor clean up.   It didn't appear to me that this location was run by anyone in management. If so, they all clearly have given up and not trying to make any improvements. I will not be going back to this location until there's a massive revamp in operation and management.

U_MucKo0ciZP2UB6-87y4g.text: Only 1 star for this location.    I love Chipotle... the quality of the food and taste is one of my favorite quick grab meals.   This location is the worst... it's quality of service has gone down hill over the past couple of years that I've frequent it. Which is very disappointing!  Tonight I went to get something to eat with my two daughters. We ordered a salad and other items from the menu.... once again quality of food good... but when we went to get our drinks and utensils, no forks.... ok so they haven't restocked the supplies.... it happens so we ask at the counter for forks.... "we have no forks" the person replied. What??? Really you sell salad but don't have anything but a spoon to eat it???  You don't mention it to us when we order that maybe we should get a burrito instead of a salad??? About 15 minutes later lo and behold someone comes out with a huge box of forks!!!! The place was empty when we went and was just staring to get busy.   How completely inconsiderate and uncaring for their clientele!!!  I repeat I love the brand but Chipotle really needs to up their employees especially at this location.

n1JfN2g8fv3bRDjNmeYajA.text: They really should start wearing hair nets. Had hair in my food twice in one month here.

JLrUntmUlWSrjgubd7TEAQ.text: I had a great experience here. Workers didn't rush you through the assembly line behind the counter. Kind and appreciative of my business. Multiple workers thanked and told me to have a great day. Food was stocked, fresh and delicious. Great chipotle location with great customer service!

5mrhuY5S6m3ov0iuUKwNfQ.text: This chipotle is as good as any other I've been in. There were young people working there and they were very attentive, even though it was super busy. Delicious as always!!

tLAJYxER3r0xQYFPfq8BJQ.text: I feel that in a world of negativity the positive review caries the most weight. That said, I rarely take the time to write a negative review but in this instance it was well deserved.  I am a Chipotle enthusiast, and can pride myself on my understanding of Chipotle's attention to quality and overall consistency and this particular location fell short. Despite many reviews eluding to this, I failed to drive the extra 3 miles to a location with better reviews. Lesson learned.  My tomato (Mild) salsa was more of a mush, Carnitas were dry and overly salted, and portion size was sparse. My bowl was literally half empty, and I got the stink eye when I asked for "a little more rice". I was also charged for double meat when the portion wasn't even that of a normal bowl at any other location! I was very disappointed.  To top it off they had no lemons or smoked Tabasco, and were unapologetic when I asked about it.  I'm not sure if this is a result of poor management, lack of training, or tight margins at this location, but my meal as a whole was very underwhelming, and that has meaning coming from someone who drives an hour each way just to pick up Chipotle.

kSgbHT-JQjBRPRNkEF22BQ.text: This location really is below the standard that chipotle is known for.  This place frequently is out of chicken steak etc at random times. Poor management.   Tonight they were out of brown rice and chicken. I didn't care but several customers did.   My burrito was ok, but the steak was dry and a bit tough. I would encourage others to avoid this location.

-1SYY_baQZpvAc5PLFKWNQ.text: I've been coming to this location for a couple years... until now. I get a burrito bowl but I like to get the rice that usually goes in the bowl in a separate bowl and get the rest of the fillings such as beans meat and salsa in another bowl (therefore making it one bowl). Every other chipotle very helpful and understanding. One night I came ordered my usual but they refused to give me my rice in a another bowl. I called the manager the next day and he apologized and gave me a free meal. I came again last night but they once again refused to give me my rice in another bowl. It's unacceptable how lazy and unreasonable these employees are.

zmNVlE6gVJmujnUkvpplMQ.text: I love this place, my favorite fast food. This location is pretty good. They stay really busy, so sometimes service can suffer, but overall a great place for lunch or dinner. I wish they had a little more seating, during peak times it's tough to get a table.

1TRvncbnRW21D-qbnpBCbg.text: Wow where do I start....  Oh chipotle chipotle why do you do me so wrong?  Just left this chipotle and the front  guy had a terrible memory asked 5 times which ingredient I asked for each time and then quickly forgot! Well it was kind of amusing...reminded me of Drew Barrymore in 50 first dates where she lost her memory each night.....moving on... They were out of almost everything... I'm patient but when they took out the silver pan and replaced it and all the gunk from the bottom of it dripped in my burrito I had to make a citizen's arrest   All the other employees looked disheveled and tired! In their defense it is sooo damn sticky and humid here but it would be good to appear like you at least took a shower at some point....  Needless to say,  I will NEVER come to this chipotle again! Not even for free... Ok for free....yes  I gave it 2 stars and not one because they had A.C.  what a bloody luxury!

-TEj7EWwuaQzKvgLRo955A.text: Went there yesterday with my sister and ordered the chicken bowl and it tasted really bad.  That's the only thing I order when I enter Chipotle restaurants. Will not be going back to this one!

7aBAWFKKbhsa5lVA4VKuiw.text: I love chipotle but this particular location has disappointed me !  First they're really busy,which it's not a big deal almost all the chipotles are always busy. However their service is kinda slow,and the food seems to be running out when I was ordering(meat and veggies containers look almost empty.) I did notice that they are refilling the food when I was about to pay,just my luck I guess.  Food is great but not the best,still way better than salsaritas though.

D812guGRqsHnXKbzSPv78A.text: Usual chipotle. Clean. Friendly team. Amount of food depends on who is serving at the moment, sometimes I get great amounts and other times, I don't. Twice I have gone here and they've forgotten something in the order, but corporate was great about replacing. Decent location.

nuxA4AY5TzCAMGtkeq9zqw.text: I ordered two bowls, went to pay, and my card expired May 2016. Today is June 1st. I don't use credit cards and had no cash on me, but they let me leave with my food anyways! Super nice staff. Thank you for treating me and my husband to lunch!

klqOJmbRfw5JCsaUh4_CAA.text: Always friendly and clean! We come to this location atleast twice a week. Manager always very nice to my kids.

F6M6ttMaBjf1Z0FGIuzz-g.text: This place hands down is nasty I had to be asked 4 times what did I order and when I finally got it.. it wasn't even wrapped all the way closed and they just threw it in a bag. The chicken it was so nasty, burnt and tasted old. The guy on the front line was rude and all over the place it was way to loud in there and it was more like a playground then a restaurant...

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Just plain sad

H6TGdg2cHg-2c7JiA4ALnA.text: This has to be one of the worst Chipotle in the Charlotte area. Been twice in the past 2 weeks and both times I'm amazed at the  little amount of food they put in the bowls. Compared to other locations this one gives you half the amount of  the other locations. Won't be back...when you pay $10 bucks for a bowl and they barely give you a half scoop of rice...ridiculous.

Zts7b0gYN1ySi58PxIbfbw.text: I am a regular at chipotle of different locations.  This one is a disappointment.  The customer service is lacking.   They charge 1.89 for guacamole, frustrating as  I do not get sour cream or cheese.  I am a vegan and was. Happy to see that they have sofritas, but disappointed in this location.

FYcL5Gi0JHuqwGTC6dQFPw.text: Chipotle's my default healthy-ish fast food option.  They make a big deal out of how they source their food, and if you get your burrito bowl-style and leave off the cheese, you can actually avoid blowing through a thousand calories on your lunch break.  This particular location is very close to my apartment, so I go there fairly often.  The staff is usually polite and they usually get my order right.  That's really all I ask when I go to a chain restaurant, since the food is (or should be) standardized.  Also, Chipotle is leagues ahead of Qdoba, Salsaritas, Moe's, etc.  This is an Adam Fact (TM).

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Barbacoa bowl

qNrTU8GnODG56kwH02Ebqw.text: It's a Chipotle, so they are all standard right?  Wrong.  Hands down the worst Chipotle I have ever been in.  This one is tucked away in a shopping center and does not receive the traffic that the others do.    I ordered a burrito and right off the bat got shorted on the rice.  Should I have asked for more rice??  Probably, but I didn't. Move on to the meat.  I got steak.  The steak had been there for a while the container was almost empty and the steak looked dry.  The server look back as to ask for the cook to cook more steak but she didn't.  She put what was left of the steak on my burrito.  It was less than the usual amount. Should I have asked for more steak??  Probably, but I didn't what to pay extra for what was turning out to be the worst burrito I have ever had.   I got a few other things on the burrito and they seemed ok.  Move onto the lettuce.  It was soggy appeared days old and looked so bad I had to pass on it. When the burrito was wrapped up it looked like a hot dog bun in foil.  It was so lacking and small that the cashier had to ask the maker what is was, because she did not initially think it was a burrito.   This experience will not keep me from going to Chipotle, but I will never go back to this Chipotle.

3vljtjVuyNx5QGso8lTQCg.text: Though it seems like there are plenty of these "build it for you" type places, whether they are Mexican-ish, or Italian-ish, or whatever-ish, Chipotle has been around for longer than most.  The fare at Chipotle is generally good, and on that front there are no surprises at this location. The main issue is the parking. This section of the shopping center suffers from what many places in Charlotte do - the developers decide "hey, there is some land" and stick some more shops in.  This both clogs the flow of traffic and can make it a challenge to get in and out of the shops in that area. This isn't necessarily the fault of Chipotle, but it does make it a bit of a challenge, so is something to keep in mind if you're in a rush - along with the other hundred or so people rushing to get their burrito bowl at lunchtime.

TnG4CCU2y39zK2vzzSSqng.text: Great chipotle location food was fresh workers were friendly. The portions were plentiful

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Burrito  bowl

4Cr20LaPj-V9_ABCdwP5YA.text: Food generally what I expected. My complaint is about cleanliness.  Floors filthy, tables dirty. Plenty of staff but no one taking initiative to police dining area. Soda area was sticky and trashy.  Bathrooms were stinky w used food service gloves laying on sink.  This used to be one of my favorite places for lunch as the vibe here used to be cool.   Need to close for a few days and steam clean the place.

QOPnwnZ42mZNp-ThUaAawQ.text: Friday night and out of so much stuff. Guy waiting to serve us playing with hair and hat and then went to touch my tortilla. No onion or cilantro. Poorly trained staff.  Long line forming due to lack of product. You need to beef up your game.

ktbCdlcGH_ojiYUcWhZgNQ.text: This location of Chipotle is absolutely horrible. We order our bowls with guacamole. There were two whole halves of avocado that were rock hard and rotten. They were jet black. Stringy absolutely disgusting. We didn't have time to go back and return them so we just ended up throwing our food away. Please higher better employees because they obviously do not care enough to realize the gigantic chunks of rotten avocado they are using. Please look at our picture and decide before you go eat there.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Rotten avocados.
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Rotten, whole hard, avocado.

mteKF0i5V0DpixP8VEeNWw.text: 3/3 times going here the food has been inedible salty. I'm not even picky about salt, but there is so much salt your blood pressure will spike. Go to the one in Monroe, or the one downtown where they know how to season food appropriately...  Long wait times too, and staff was very flustered and unable to keep meats/queso/fajitas/guacamole stocked. They were fighting amongst themselves too to air their frustrations.  Won't be going here again.

Y1ivY1xUYYh7N21wttFvoQ.text: I predict chipotle will be non existent in a few years if the preparation, seasoning, and quality of their food keeps declining.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. A soupy salad bowl, disgusting .

6bzb2vw8eLE3EBMgGSCCfQ.text: The only reason I give this place one star is because I have to. I have made three different trips there, and it consistently has the worse service and product selection. This last visit was at 8:45 at night. I began placing my order and got all the way to the veggies to find out they were out of lettuce. Well actually they had lettuce, they just weren't prepping any more for the night. They were also out of white rice. They don't close until 10.00, and had plenty of workers standing around talking. Customers were coming in, looking at the options, and leaving. What we wanted was sofritas and chicken, which they had plenty of. I have two major complaints about this location. First, they are always out of something. Second, the young African American woman who runs the register has the most dry, rude, and condescending way of speaking to customers. It's so annoying that she is ALWAYS on register, so you have to interact with her. This is coming from a public school Freshman teacher of 15 years.  The young lady is quick to says she's been there for X years, but she doesn't embody the welcoming attitude of someone vested in Chipotle. On a previous visit, I had ordered five burritos; I asked her which burritos were which, since one was for my son who has special dietary restrictions. Her response was, "How would I know?", "They are numbered by how YOU put the order in." I was so put off by her attitude. I calmly explained to her that all other Chipotles have labeled them according to ingredients like "S" for steak or "v" for vegan, which makes it easier for a customer like me who orders multiple burritos. I have a family of five, and I am very familiar with the routine of differentiating the burritos. I talked with the cashier before I wrote this review, I explained I do reviews quite often, and I really have been trying to give them the benefit of the doubt, but they just don't seem to be able to get it together. I travel a lot for work and I frequently stop at Chipotle because of the quality. This particular location is just awful and the cashier is unreasonable. She clearly believes her seniority gives her a pass to be nonchalant and or indifferent towards good customer service and the values of integrity's that Chipotle" has in their mission statement.

kXX8_8kScWVvL3ZuLEzvGg.text: I ordered online for pickup. Today I got the whole 30 bowl (carnitas salad).  The meat was so salty that my mouth physically hurt and I had to throw the entire thing away after just a couple bites. I've never had this problem before but it's left me not wanting to try again

W0a4EhNFRXmxAmVPgqowHw.text: Tasty food but I don't see the big deal.  I gave it two tries in a span of 7 months.  Had a taste for a bowl and tried the barbacoa this time.  Last time I got chicken.  It's a Tuesday night and the time was unbelievably long to me.  Everyone seemed to be okay with the wait plus it was teacher appreciation night (I had heard).  The rice, meat, and lettuce was steadily being replenished.  Side condiments were given without a charge.  I just don't care for this food.  It's affordable and it's a hearty serving but I don't think it taste better than Sabor (order everything) or Moe's (I get burritos).

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Long line on a TUESDAY cuz they CHOOSEY
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Loaded
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Steak bowl

u2Z0j3YQXUfzPT2niE0q5A.text: The food's taste and quality is almost the same of any chipotle, but customer service is excellent at this location. I ordered extra tortillas and they actually served it to my table.  This is extra points. I wish I could give more then five stars to them.

X7o5_6ZG6zOd9iTxg6bHLQ.text: I ordered ahead of time online and instead of alerting me when I got there to pick up my order that they were out of lettuce and chips they simply gave me my order and because I was in a hurry I didn't check my order. Both things were missing in when I called the manager was very short with me and unapologetic. I wouldn't have cared if they would've simply explained and not charge me for things I didn't get.

a4mUxP3R2xQL7OYGtFq42w.text: Way overpriced for what you get... and certainly not because the quality makes up for it. I'll go to competing restaurants over Chipotle going forward.

oP6yS-ZK3qbbKv4J2eEm3w.text: I've been here many times before and had a great experience, even in the past 25 days. However, I went tonight around 8pm to get food for my wife and I. The guacamole was obviously old, I didn't realize that was even what it was till they went to scoop the brown goop. Chips were stale and most ingredients were empty.  All suggested that the employees were ready to get out of the building. The bad guac pretty much ruined the meal and we couldn't eat it or the food it was put on. Unappealing to look at, and had to give up on the meal.  This has not been the norm at all with this location, so I don't know what was going on. However management needs to watch over the closing process. After the experience, I'm selling my shares of chipotle and probably hitting up Moe's.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Matthews, NC, United States. Brown guac

nA_8de636PowMp2S8jr8nQ.text: Literally my SECOND time at any chipotle. I really thought it was weird to rush me in a non existent line. I also find is funny that you ran out of salad and filled on the bottom of half of what she gave the older couple in front of me, while you yelled for me, I had to ask for more lettuce because she didn't fill it up. Yall gave the older couple a nice amount of chicken. I literally threw away half of my salad because you gave me half a freaking spoon full. I will never come back here again for a 7 dollar sandwich when I can go up the road and get a buffet for 8 dollars with fresh fruits and veggies with salad. VERY disappointed.  Update: the hispanic lady whose there on week day openings is the best! Good portions, great smile, friendly! Food portion has increased with price increase.

FSpDkRfD6Ht84a2Hmqms5A.text: Let me just start this off with a statement. Chipotle is the holy grail of restaurants. It is my favorite place on earth and I want to conceive my children here someday so that chipotle will always be a part of them. However, this chipotle is very on and off. Whenever I walk in, my mood either drops or goes sky high depending on who I see serving the rice, beans, and chicken. I have been here so many times that I know the exact portions I will be given based on who is serving it. Sadly, I have had to leave and take myself and my wallet elsewhere when I have seen a certain worker. Today was one of those days, but I was with some friends so I decided to stay. The man served my friend and I one weenie scoop of white rice and far more beans, creating an undesirable mixture. He then gave me quite small portions of chicken and steak, which does not allow my taste buds to be purely satisfied come feasting time. Luckily, the good lady was up next, so my portions of guac, corn, cheese, and mild salsa were all above my expectations. Chipotle, I love you, but please be more consistent and let me know how great my portions are gonna be every time I walk in.

SNEqZQAHLoJcDvyr9agJxw.text: No military discount and they seemed proud of it.   Truly a McDonald's run place the food substandard and the people were not nice when it was mentioned. Veterans and military alike Stay away from this place. The chips were not fresh and not crunchy. Queso tasted powdery and flat the burrito was of a McDonald's quality for too much money.  Avoid!!!

3PqdAb2grHT9tpl7rtO5Tg.text: Not sure what's going on with this Chipotle location. I am a regular here for lunch and the last few times I've been here there were a few issues. They have been out of items such as fajita vegetables and chopped lettuce, which I end up waiting for while they refill, on my lunch break. The people assembling the food also seem to be stressed and in a rush yet operating more slowly than usual. I used to be in and out with my to go order in less than 5 minutes, but not lately.  This is happening when they aren't even that busy. What prompted me to write this review today, though is the rude service I received from one of the employees. I've never encountered this at any Chipotle and a large majority of the people here are quite nice, personable and hard-working. However, one young lady assembling food today gave me a very blunt and interrupting "I can't hear you" when I asked for my toppings. Granted, it's loud in there but she could've responded with a polite, "Could you repeat that?" or "What was that?"   Ugh! I have no tolerance for rude service. I've been in the food industry and I would never treat a customer like that.   I was not surprised to see other similar reviews when I came to write this one today. Hopefully management will read these and get this place back to normal. If not I will probably get my Chipotle fix at another location on my way home from work.   Update: So, I've been back recently and they seem to have all new staff and management at this location. Big improvements in speed and friendliness of service!!

QIAHa2wyf0Qf-K5nd9xCEA.text: Wish they could be better with portion sizes.....  Person ahead of me got twice the amount of each item!  What's up with that?

2fnXD7SGnHtiZNp8SIKUmQ.text: Nice job on the rice. Had brown and white and both cooked adequately. Can't say the same for all Chipotle locations.
